repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Structural Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project will support the second phase of the
            Government's structural adjustment program which aims
            at improving the allocation and efficiency of investment
            over the medium term. The second phase of the program
            includes: (i) a fundamental reform of the Philippines'
            industrial incentives and promotion policy; (ii) an
            extension of the ongoing trade policy reform through
            measures in indirect taxation, import liberalization, and
            tariffs; and (iii) reforms in the area of energy policy and
            public resource management. The program is described in the
            Government's Letter of Development Policy to the Bank.
            The loan will finance essential imports. The main benefits
            of the program will be improvements in the allocation and
            efficiency of industrial investment as well as in a major
            part of public investment; the program will also improve the
            structure of the balance of payments by limiting the
            country's reliance on foreign savings and reducing the
            current account deficit to more sustainable levels.
